message.content:
cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with recognizing actions in egocentric videos, which involves computer vision and machine learning techniques. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the difficulty in segmenting hand/objects and recognizing object or hand pose, which suggests a focus on human-computer interaction, leading to cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) as the second likely sub-category. The use of bag of words classifier and feature trajectories indicates a focus on multimedia analysis, leading to cs.MM (Multimedia) as the third likely sub-category. The use of machine learning techniques for classification suggests a focus on machine learning, leading to cs.LG (Machine Learning) as the fourth likely sub-category. Finally, the use of feature trajectories for action recognition suggests a focus on information retrieval, leading to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as the fifth likely sub-category.
